assetIdentification.assetDescription: Control vehicle door locks through IVI system

methodology.name: ISO21434 Risk Assessment
methodology.description: Combination of impact rating from Impact Analysis and attack feasibility from Threat Scenarios to determine cybersecurity risk

risks.title: Unauthorized Door Unlock Risk
risks.description: Risk of an attacker spoofing door unlock commands to gain unauthorized access to the vehicle

impactRating.justification: Potential for vehicle theft, personal property loss, and serious safety implications if doors unlock while vehicle is in motion

attackFeasibilityRating.justification: Physical access to the vehicle is required, along with specialized knowledge and equipment to analyze and inject CAN messages

riskRating.justification: The combination of Severe impact and Medium attack feasibility results in a High risk rating according to the risk matrix

riskTreatment.acceptanceCriteria: Risk must be reduced to Medium or lower through implementation of security controls

treatmentOptions.description: Implement message authentication for door lock control commands
Add contextual validation of door unlock commands (e.g., vehicle state check)
Implement secure gateway with enhanced filtering for critical messages

residualRisk.justification: Implementation of selected treatments will significantly reduce attack feasibility without changing impact

risks.title: Replay Attack Risk
risks.description: Risk of an attacker capturing and replaying door unlock commands to gain unauthorized access to the vehicle

impactRating.justification: Vehicle theft and property loss risks similar to direct spoofing, but generally limited to parked vehicle contexts

attackFeasibilityRating.justification: Requires initial access to record messages, but replay execution is straightforward with minimal technical knowledge

riskRating.justification: The combination of Major impact and Medium attack feasibility results in a Medium risk rating according to the risk matrix

riskTreatment.acceptanceCriteria: Risk must be reduced to Low or lower through implementation of security controls

treatmentOptions.description: Implement challenge-response authentication for door lock control
Add timestamps or sequence counters to door lock commands
Implement session-based authentication for door control operations

residualRisk.justification: Implementation of selected treatments will significantly reduce attack feasibility without changing impact

risks.title: Denial of Service Risk
risks.description: Risk of an attacker disrupting door lock control functionality through denial of service attack on the CAN bus

impactRating.justification: Primarily operational impact with potential for user dissatisfaction, but safety systems typically maintain door state during failure

attackFeasibilityRating.justification: Basic technical knowledge is sufficient to execute a DoS attack once access to the CAN bus is obtained

riskRating.justification: The combination of Moderate impact and High attack feasibility results in a Medium risk rating according to the risk matrix

riskTreatment.acceptanceCriteria: Risk must be reduced to Low or lower through implementation of security controls

treatmentOptions.description: Implement CAN bus monitoring and anomaly detection
Add rate limiting for CAN messages in gateway ECU
Implement redundant communication path for critical functions
Enhanced bus-off recovery strategy for critical ECUs

residualRisk.justification: Implementation of selected treatments will reduce attack feasibility without changing impact

securityControls.title: Message Authentication
securityControls.description: Implement HMAC-based authentication for door control commands using vehicle-specific keys

securityControls.title: Command Timestamping
securityControls.description: Add timestamping to door lock/unlock commands with validation of freshness

securityControls.title: Contextual Validation
securityControls.description: Implement validation of vehicle state before executing door unlock commands

securityControls.title: Secure Gateway
securityControls.description: Implement secure gateway with enhanced filtering for critical commands

securityControls.title: Session-based Authentication
securityControls.description: Implement session-based authentication for door control operations

securityControls.title: CAN Anomaly Detection
securityControls.description: Implement CAN bus monitoring and anomaly detection for DoS attacks

securityControls.title: Rate Limiting
securityControls.description: Implement rate limiting for CAN messages in gateway ECU

securityControls.title: Enhanced Bus-off Recovery
securityControls.description: Implement enhanced bus-off recovery strategy for critical ECUs

relatedStandards.description: Risk assessment and risk treatment decision

relatedRequirements.description: The door locking system shall maintain door security even in the presence of malformed CAN messages
The door locking system shall complete a lock/unlock command within 500ms of user initiation under normal operating conditions
relatedRequirements.cybersecurityGoal: Ensure availability of door security functions

relatedRequirements.description: The system shall verify the integrity of door lock/unlock commands before execution
relatedRequirements.cybersecurityGoal: Prevent tampering with door lock commands

relatedRequirements.description: The system shall require authentication for door lock/unlock commands from the IVI interface

contentSummary: Risk assessment for Door Lock Control Interface analyzing three key risks: unauthorized door unlock (RA-DOOR-01, High risk), replay attack on door commands (RA-DOOR-02, Medium risk), and denial of service (RA-DOOR-03, Medium risk). Assessment combines impact ratings from impact analysis and attack feasibility from threat scenarios. Risk treatment involves 8 security controls including message authentication, command timestamping, contextual validation, secure gateway implementation, session-based authentication, anomaly detection, rate limiting, and enhanced bus-off recovery. Implementation of these controls is estimated to reduce all risks to acceptable levels (Medium or Low), addressing key security requirements for door lock functionality.
